description.value: HL7-defined code system of concepts specifying the observation sub-type. Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging in the OBX segment.

purpose.value: Underlying Master Code System for V2 table 0937 (Observation Sub-Type)

copyright.value: Copyright HL7. Licensed under creative commons public domain

description.value: Version of HL7 in which the code was deprecated

valueString.value: Sub-type of QST (Question) - OBX-5 value is answer to an Ask at Order Entry question
Sub-type of QST (Question) - OBX-5 value is answer to an Ask at Order Entry question
Sub-type of QST (Question) - OBX-5 value is answer to an Ask at Specimen Collection question
Sub-type of QST (Question) - OBX-5 value is answer to an Ask at Specimen Collection question
Examples are: no growth, normal flora

definition.value: Sub-type of RSLT (Result) This term identifies observations that give overall culture outcome, when no specific organism is being named.

valueString.value: Examples: catalase positive, hemolytic, etc.

definition.value: Sub-type of RSLT (Result) This term identifies any other observations about the isolate.

valueString.value: Examples: <10,000 CFU, >100,00 CFU, Few, Moderate, Many, etc.

definition.value: Sub-type of RSLT (Result) This term identifies growth levels of an isolate – can be numeric or categorical.

valueString.value: Examples are: Genus Serratia, Neisseria meningitidis, Escherichia coli O157:H7, but also identification on a culture plate like presumptive Proteus species.

definition.value: Sub-type of RSLT (Result) This term identifies observations that name a specific organism either at the species or the genus level.

valueString.value: Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - qualifies the result as an isolate.
Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - qualifies the result as an isolate.
Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - result is a modifier of the isolate (e.g., Few, Some, etc.)
Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - result is a modifier of the isolate (e.g., Few, Some, etc.)
Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - qualifies result as microbiology not related to any isolate (e.g., gram stain observations)
Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - qualifies result as microbiology not related to any isolate (e.g., gram stain observations)

definition.value: Sub-type of RSLT (Result) This term identifies observations that do not fit the culture status, but is not at the isolate level.

valueString.value: Examples are: many gram positive rods, acid fast bacteria seen, etc.

definition.value: Sub-type of RSLT (Result) This term identifies observations on gram stains (and other stains or smears) on the clinical sample.

valueString.value: Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - result coming over is additional material, for example points on a graph, an image, raw instrument data, links to related observations, etc.
Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - result coming over is additional material, for example points on a graph, an image, raw instrument data, links to related observations, etc.
Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - result value is for micro susceptibility/sensitivity
Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - result value is for micro susceptibility/sensitivity
Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - result falls outside of the other sub-types.
Sub-type of RSLT (Result) - result falls outside of the other sub-types.
